topic.title: Tox thread and NetTalk group chat, share IDs, make friends and love life
youtube-dl taken down by DMCA (backups provided)
topic.body:
See for yourselves: https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/releases/download/2020.09.20/youtube-dl-2020.09.20.tar.gz

I made a IFS mirror, it has the pypi wheel (installation file), the tar.gz (that you can just extract and run) and the git repo.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:15f1_15cApprVFcr1skAkWssq5aAXKa7pDwJJve_item_2+type:archive

Please toggle: "Help distribute added optional files" to help distribute the files.

UPDATE: @youtube-dl put it on git center: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1CXohM8XBz3mUGUR8w9CYXqdYt5JzfoPfi

topic.title: How to find out which user signed a zite?
topic.body: What fields do I look for in the contents.json and user.json to?

1520866054_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_122_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): is it easy not to be scammed on that site? I am aware that in my country inter-bank payments can be reversed..Btw, per their TOS they may also require identity documents once users pass certain trade volume limits, during trade disputes, fraud investigations, and to ensure account ownership. [...]

Your country might have  a localbitcoin clone. I use mine's. TOS might differ then.
You could get around those limitations by using multiple accounts and trading small volumes at a time. In fact, you should always trade small volumes at a time.

I looked into bisq some time ago. I don't remember why I didn't use but it seems fine.

PS.: Check if whichever service you are using has support for multisig escrow.
I just tried to login into localbitcoins.com and they are asking for my full name and phone number. I guess I will start using bisq.

Thanks. I will check those links and I will post my opinion on bisq after I use it.
But beware that they mention in the FAQ and the dispute resolution guidelines that they may require identifying information to resolve disputes.

Rant: 
Idk what goes through people's head. It must be shit.
Banks ask for a shit load of personal information because they are highly regulated and they can give you loans and a credit card. It amazes me how anyone can think it's reasonable to give all that information to a literally-who that runs a website from the other side of the world.
Holly shit it's shear stupidity.
As my mom used to say: "Don't give any personal information on the Web. You can never really know who is on the other side."

You can actually run a full bitcoin node on modest hardware. I synced in a few days with a mobile i3 from 2012, 4GB of ram and a SSD.
The bottleneck to syncing is IO, not CPU. All you need is an SSD or preferably a ramdisk.
Since the blockchain is over 200GB you will probably want to prune it. You can prune it down up to 550MB. The most important directories that should be either on the SSD or the ramdisk are `blocks/index` and `chainstate`.
I don't think chainstate went over 4GB during my sync. `blocks/index` is like 100MB.

After the initial sync catching up is fast. If you only re sync once a week it should take less than 30 minutes.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_131_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): 40% drop in Bitcoin price: https://www.blockchain.com/charts/market-price?timespan=all [...]

I'm planning on doing the same soon.

Sorry. I've been offline for a while. Your request is not showing up, try sending it again.

1585233010_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body: It would be nice to a good have a privacy respecting site. Neither google, yandex or bing work well with tor. I think tinyeye is not privacy respecting and gives bad results in general. Idk about infrigement.report but my hopes are not high.

1603487455_15cApprVFcr1skAkWssq5aAXKa7pD.body:
> [claude](#comment_2_1MUCEEtbLUYFpc6vqhp4F5u4ia8MJ9RGK1): only a matter of time before youtube tweaks their DMCA and all the current copies of youtube-dl become useless. might as well download while one can

You mean their API? Youtube-dl works for other sites too.

> [slondrex](#comment_1_1AMDCwJEDNWWiP3KVp5M9vCCaj91tefBbB): Has the project itself said what they're doing next?

Not that I'm aware of.
It seems they have not given up: https://yt-dl.org/
